title: Customer Service Representative Job at Wellington Clinics
content:
The Wellington Clinics was established on February 22, 2011, Wellington Clinics is a private, free-standing specialist hospital located at Plot 321 Gidan Fulani Street, Dape, Life Camp, Abuja.

Wellington Clinics offers a comprehensive range of healthcare treatment options for children, adolescents, and adults facing various health challenges. Our facility is designed and furnished with the most advanced medical and surgical technologies available globally, enhancing our ability to deliver high-quality care to our patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative 

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and responding to correspondence related to Emergency Neurosurgery cases, ensuring timely communication, professionalism, and efficient service delivery.


Responsibilities


	Handle all incoming and outgoing correspondence on emergency neurosurgical cases
	Provide clear, courteous, and timely communication with patients, families, and referring facilities
	Maintain accurate documentation and follow up on all emergency-related inquiries
	Assist with patient support services as required
	Work closely with the clinical team to ensure effective information flow


Requirements
Required Course of Study:


	Applicants must hold a degree in any of the following:
	
		Public Administration.
		Public Relations.
	
	
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in customer service, front desk, or client relations
	Experience in a medical or emergency service environment is an added advantage.


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: jobs@wellingtonclinicsabuja.com using "Application for Customer Service Representative" as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Cashier & Cook

	Strong leadership, motivational and management skills.

	Integrity
	Pro-active self-starter
	Assertive and tenacious
	Ability to work with little or no supervision
	Highly organized and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities.

Salary is highly attractive + HMO pension + 13th month salary + free lunch.

  "description": "DreamCity Property &amp; Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Projects Coordinator
Job Locations:&nbsp;Jabi, Abuja (FCT) &amp; Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are looking for a strategic and results-driven Projects Coordinatorsto provide overall leadership for our project portfolios.
	The ideal candidate will be a seasoned professional with extensive experience in managing large-scale real estate projects, including high-rise buildings and navigating the regulatory landscape of Lagos.
	You will be responsible for ensuring all projects are delivered efficiently, on time, within budget, and in full compliance with all state regulations.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide overarching technical and administrative direction for the entire project lifecycle of multiple real estate developments, including high-rise buildings, from conception to handover.
	Serve as the primary point of contact for all regulatory engagements, specifically with Lagos State agencies (e.g., LASPPPA, LASBCA, and AGIS, Abuja Development Control, Ministry of Physical Planning) to secure all necessary permits and approvals.
	Implement and monitor advanced project management methodologies to optimize resource allocation, streamline processes, and ensure peak project performance.
	Oversee the preparation, management, and adherence to project timelines and budgets, ensuring financial objectives are met and cost-saving initiatives are identified and implemented.
	Lead, mentor, and manage a large, multidisciplinary team of Project Managers, Engineers, Site Supervisors, and technical staff.
	Establish and enforce rigorous quality assurance, health, safety, and environmental (HSE) standards across all project sites.
	Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate project risks related to construction, logistics, regulations, and timelines.
	Act as the senior representative in engagements with clients, investors, joint venture partners, contractors, and professional consultants.
	Oversee the negotiation, execution, and management of major project contracts, ensuring compliance with terms and conditions.
	Provide regular and comprehensive project status reports, including performance against KPIs, to the Managing Director/Board.


Qualifications and Experience


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. A Master&rsquo;s degree in a relevant field is highly preferred.
	Mandatory Professional Certification: Must be a fully registered and licensed member of the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN) and the Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE). A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a distinct advantage.
	A minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in senior project management roles, with a verifiable track record of delivering large-scale real estate and construction projects in Lagos.
	Demonstrable and extensive experience in liaising with Lagos State lands and building regulatory agencies, with a proven ability to navigate the approval process efficiently.
	Must have spent a significant portion of their career within the real estate development and construction industry.
	Strong financial acumen with proven experience in multi-billion Naira project budgeting and cost control.
	Candidates must be within the age range of 40 to 50 years.
	Proven track record of successfully delivering multiple, complex high-rise or large-scale building projects on time and within budget.


Method of Application&nbsp;
